Event.name: Cause_expansion
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or non-human <fen>Cause</fen> causes an <fen>Item</fen> to change its physical size. The <fen>Size_change</fen> of an <fen>Item</fen> may be explicitly indicated or characterized in terms of <fen>Initial_size</fen> and/or <fen>Result_size</fen>. In the default case, expansion is along all dimensions, but sometimes the <fen>Dimension</fen> of expansion is incorporated or made explicit.
<ex>If the design crashes too often, then try <t>lengthening</t> <fex name="Item">the wings</fex> <fex name="Size_change">by a few centimeters</fex>, <fex name="Result_size">to perhaps 30cm total</fex>. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex> <fex name="Dimension">INI</fex> </ex>
<ex>As the juice churned with natural process of changing into wine, <fex name="Cause">the gas it created</fex> would <t>expand</t> <fex name="Item">the balloon</fex>, and when the balloon eventually deflated, it was ready to drink.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>With some words in this frame, an <fen>Agent</fen> who causes the change in size of the <fen>Item</fen> may be present. The <fen>Agent</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument of a verb.
<ex><fex name="Agt">Management</fex> <t>expanded</t> the company.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Item
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Item</fen> is frequently the External Argument of verbs or the NP Object if an <fen>Agent</fen> is expressed.
<ex><fex name="Item">The company</fex> <t>expanded</t>.</ex> <ex>Management <t>expanded</t> <fex name="Item">the company</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_size
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Initial_size</fen> is rarely expressed without <fen>Result_size</fen> also being explicit. <fen>Initial_size</fen> generally occurs in a PP-<ment>from</ment> Complement.
<ex>The glacier <t>shrank</t> <fex name="Initial">from 1km square</fex> to 400 square meters.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result_size
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Result_size</fen> is typically expressed in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>.
<ex>I <t>grow</t> vegetables <fex name="Result">until they weigh 25 pounds</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Size_change
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Size_change</fen> identifies the amount by which the size of an <fen>Item</fen> changes.
<ex>A <fex name="Sizec">2-3cm</fex> <t>expansion</t> in width is required.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Dimension
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Change of size may be limited to or described in terms of a single <fen>Dimension</fen>.
<ex>The image was <t>enlarged</t> <fex name="Dim">in height</fex>.</ex> <ex>The machinist <t>narrowed</t> the tube by 6 inches <fex name="Dim">in diameter</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Agent</fen> brings about the expansion of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> of performing an action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Co-variable
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The feature that the size of the Item is varied in step with.
<ex>I <t>narrowed</t> the viewport <fex name="Co_Var">with the increasing glare</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Group
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Group</fen> in which an <fen>Item</fen> changes size.
<ex>Tails <t>lengthened</t> 10% <fex name="Grp">among rats more than 3 days old</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Rate
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Rate</fen> identifies the rate of change of the value.
<ex>The balloon <t>inflates</t> <fex name="Rate">about 2 cubic cm a minute</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is a non-human entity which brings about the change in size.</def-root>

Arg.name: Elapsed_time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Elapsed_time</fen> is the amonut of time in which the change occurs. <ex><fex name="Item">The sun</fex> would <t>shrink</t> <fex name="Result_size">to a point</fex> <fex name="Elapsed_time">in a matter of minutes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Item</fen> to expand.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> cause the expansion of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the expansion of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the expansion of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: aggrandizement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the result of causing something to seem greater.

lexUnit.name: augmentation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of augmenting.

lexUnit.name: contraction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the process of contracting [decreasing in size, number, or range].

lexUnit.name: dilate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make wider, larger, or more open.

lexUnit.name: enlarge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become bigger.

lexUnit.name: enlargement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: to act of causing something to grow larger

lexUnit.name: expand.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to become larger in any dimension

lexUnit.name: expansion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or an instance of expanding.

lexUnit.name: growth.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of getting bigger

lexUnit.name: inflate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: to expand or cause to expand by filling with air or gas.

lexUnit.name: lengthen.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become longer.

lexUnit.name: magnification.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: making appear larger than it is

lexUnit.name: magnify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make (something) appear larger than it is, especially with a lens or microscope.

lexUnit.name: reduction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or fact of reducing something.

lexUnit.name: shrink.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become or make smaller in size or amount; contract

lexUnit.name: swell.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make an entity greater size

lexUnit.name: widen.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become wider.

lexUnit.name: narrow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: to become narrower

lexUnit.name: grow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to increase in size

lexUnit.name: blow up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: inflate or enlarge something.

lexUnit.name: stretch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause something to increase in surface area often by pulling apart from opposite sides.

lexUnit.name: compress.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to press together or condense

lexUnit.name: compression.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of compressing, or state of being compressed

lexUnit.name: condense.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make more dense or compact
